Okay, even though it isn't as polished as I'd like it to be, I made a video for a class project featuring Xerath, Nasus, (also Jarvan's fabulous death screams) and Renekton before the Shurima event came out. What better time to show it than now? Everything seen was hand drawn by me over the course of a week while juggling life, health, and work issues. Nonetheless, thank you Riot for inspiring me with your wonderful works! Here's to you!

I present to you, "*Brothers* " !

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wgJaPEa3xSw

Huzzah for first time postings! Ha ha!
thats a really good vid its nice to see people actually put efffort into these things it turned out great!
really well done! I greatly enjoyed it.

Working on a Yordle for Shurima. One that isn't Amumu. >.>
Hate to break it to you... Amumu isnt a Yordle now. They reverted him back to being a mummy child. He's now back to how he originally was.

"Perhaps one of the oddest champions in the League of Legends is the yordle known as Amumu."

Not sure if trolling, but just in case someone takes that as truth, I don't want people "correcting" me when I say Amumu is a yordle.

he was retcon back to being a humans hold a I a a mummified during the Shurima event. He along with several other champions had their lore changed. Riot is just incredibly slow about updating everything. 

They haven't even updated Viktor's champion page on the website.

In game and out of game, (( one being updated, the other not )) neither mention Amumu's race as human unless you count his original lore that was quickly altered. Although I will give you the right to hold your opinion about him now being human, the new lore never mentions him being human. He's only referred to as an animated corpse. Until his new lore is properly rewritten, I will stick to Amumu's old lore referring to him as part of the yordle race/species until later clarified differently.

> Hate to break it to you... Amumu isnt a Yordle now. They reverted him back to being a mummy child. He's now back to how he originally was.

Okay? Still gives reason for there to be yordles in the Shurima area.
